answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!If you have recently started a birth control pill, then it could be the side effect of this medicine. Hence consult your gynecologist regarding this. Breathlessness can be also be due to several causes. The commonest cause is anemia. It can also be due to asthma like conditions, bronchitis, high blood pressure, diabetes, hypothyroidism or obesity. Certain heart conditions (like a murmur) too can cause breathlessness. If it is not the pill, the best thing would be to consult a general practitioner or PCP and try and assess what is the cause of your problem. Then proper referral for concerned specialist can take things further and get you proper treatment. Hope this helps. Take care!

question: I am a 19yr old female in good/healthy physical condition, but for the past few days I have been experiencing shortness of breath.  I just recently had a check-up with my gynecologist and I am now on birth control.  All my test results have come up normal, I do not have any family history of disease excluding an uncle with diabetes.  The only medical imperfection I have ever had was a minor heart murmur, which my doctor said was most likely harmless.  My grandfather had a heart murmur and lived to be 84.  My shortness of breath seems to be persistent throughout the day, and although it is not necessarily painful, it is causing me discomfort.  On a scale of one to ten, I would say my stress level equals about a five.  However, I am becoming more stressed because of some difficulty breathing.  I don't know what this could be due to.  Please help.
title: mild shortness of breath without physical activity, 19 years old
